intro: Scorzonera kultiassovi, commonly known as the Kultisov's scorzonera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Scorzonera kultiassovi has a taproot system, which allows it to access deep water sources. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
